titles.title: Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary Act
A bill to designate Monterey Bay, California, as a national marine sanctuary.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.
Executive Comment Requested from Interior, Commerce, State, DOT, EPA.
Referred to Subcommittee on Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment.

committee.subcommittee: Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment
committee.name: House Merchant Marine and Fisheries

bill.summary: 1/22/1987--Introduced. Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary Act - Designates the Monterey Bay, California, as a national marine sanctuary. Directs the Secretary of Commerce to prepare an environmental impact statement on such designation. Requires the Secretary to also prepare a management plan for such area, to be submitted to the Congress. Provides for congressional disapproval of such sanctuary designation if the Congress enacts a joint resolution within 45 days denying such designation. States in what way the Sanctuary Act applies with respect to the Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary.
